evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation

extracted.value: May 5, 2022: Settlement entered by SC NAACP and House Defendants.

evidence.text: The Panel declines to approve the settlement

extracted.value: The Panel declines to approve the settlement

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: be delivered to the Governor for signature on or before May 12, 2022

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: Governor will have until May 17, 2022 to sign and enact H.1024 into law

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: Under the Agreement, House Defendants shall amend an already existing bill, H.1024,2 as soon as practicable so as to include the Settlement Maps in H.1024.3

extracted.value: House Defendants shall amend bill H.1024 to include Settlement Maps.

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: be delivered to the Governor for signature on or before May 12, 2022

extracted.value: H.1024 will be delivered to the Governor for signature on or before May 12, 2022.

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: Governor will have until May 17, 2022 to sign and enact H.1024 into law

extracted.value: Governor will have until May 17, 2022 to sign and enact H.1024 into law.

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: In exchange, SC NAACP will voluntarily dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice by filing a stipulation under Fed. R. Civ. P. 15(a)(2) to amend their Complaint to remove Counts One and Two

extracted.value: SC NAACP will voluntarily dismiss Counts One and Two without prejudice by filing a stipulation under Fed. R. Civ. P. 15(a)(2).

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: The Agreement contemplates that if H.1024 is not enacted as agreed upon, House Defendants will provide written consent that there is good cause for SC NAACP to amend their Complaint to re-allege Counts One and Two, or may refile Counts One and Two in a new action

extracted.value: If H.1024 is not enacted as agreed upon, House Defendants will provide written consent for SC NAACP to re-allege or refile Counts One and Two.

evidence.source_document: Status Update Regarding Settlement by Legislation
evidence.text: Under the Agreement, the Parties’ deposition notices, document requests, and discovery motions are withdrawn without prejudice and will only commence if Counts One and Two are refiled as contemplated above

extracted.value: Deposition notices, document requests, and discovery motions are withdrawn without prejudice and will only commence if Counts One and Two are refiled.

evidence.text: The Panel declines to approve the settlement
